articles.title: Celebrating the 15th Anniversary of the IEEE and HKN Merger
articles.summary: In the histories of two long-established organizations—the Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) honor society, founded in 1904, and IEEE, formed in 1963—15 years might not seem very long. articles.title: How Nauto’s AI Dashcam Reduces Driver Risk and Accidents
articles.summary: Driving trucks is one of the unappreciated backbones of modern civilization. It’s also hard and sometimes dangerous work. articles.title: How Cryptocurrency Captured the Dream of the Decentralized Web
articles.summary: The term Web3 was originally coined by Ethereum cofounder Gavin Wood as a secure, decentralized, peer-to-peer version of the Internet. articles.summary: If you credit luck instead of skill for your professional accomplishments, and if you struggle to accept praise, you might be experiencing imposter syndrome. articles.title: If We Want Bigger Wind Turbines, We’re Gonna Need Bigger Airplanes
articles.summary: The world’s largest airplane, when it’s built, will stretch more than a football field from tip to tail. articles.title: The Real Story on AI’s Water Use–and How to Tackle It
articles.summary: AI is hot, capturing headlines, investments, and users. It also runs hot, literally: The data centers operating artificial intelligence (AI) models use large amounts of electricity and generate enormous heat. articles.summary: Natcast, the non-profit organization created to run the U.S. CHIPS & Science Act’s National Semiconductor Technology Center (NSTC) told the majority of its staff they would be laid off this week, IEEE Spectrum has learned. articles.title: Help Celebrate IEEE Day on 7 October
